name: Palindrome Partitioning II

similar_questions.title: Maximum Number of Non-overlapping Palindrome Substrings

title: Palindrome Partitioning II
content:
Given a string s, partition s such that every substring of the partition is a palindrome.

Return the minimum cuts needed for a palindrome partitioning of s.

 

Example 1:

Input: s = "aab"
Output: 1
Explanation: The palindrome partitioning ["aa","b"] could be produced using 1 cut.

Example 2:

Input: s = "a"
Output: 0

Example 3:

Input: s = "ab"
Output: 1

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= s.length <= 2000
  • s consists of lowercase English letters only.

discussion_posts.name: akhilg11
discussion_posts.content: Gives TLE if you follow striver\'s code for this question

discussion_posts.name: bhardwajshubh
discussion_posts.content: Incase if you get Memory exceed try to give string as refrence in every function.

discussion_posts.name: Kurdush
discussion_posts.content: here all the test cases  are given with small length there should be atleast one test case with length =5

discussion_posts.name: dhnanj
discussion_posts.content: for the test case s = "aabaa" the expected answer by leetcode is 0 as it is a palindrome in whole but, as far as my understanding of the question we need a partitioning which has all its substrings as palindrome and if we don\'t partition here then the substrings "aab" & "baa" are not palindromes thus the answer for the above test case should be 2 (aa|b|aa).\npls correct me if I\'m wrong.\nthanks in advance!

discussion_posts.name: DowningToDownBad
discussion_posts.content: Tip: If you are following striver, you may be tempted to split in left and right part (MCM) calculate min cuts for left and right independently and get a 2D solution.\nThis is not needed try to think of 1D solution.

discussion_posts.name: Aman__Bhardwaj
mrprashantkumar
discussion_posts.content: TLE?\nUse recursion to check for palindrome and memoize the results.
